The ocean or sea, which surrounds the earth and is connected via underground rivers to Lake Akuena in the mythological Sky.
Adverbalizing suffix for verbs which results in a participle form; it is always accompanied by the prefix t- and an indicator referring to one of the arguments of the verb (w-, n-, or ∅-)

fruit or gourd of the calabash tree (Crescentia cujete)

A nominalizing suffix primarily affixed to prepositions but also to some spatial adverbs, converting the original prepositional or adverbial phrase P into one meaning “that which is (at) P”.
Nominalizer for intransitive verbs that have no person-marking

(Maquiritari mythology) The mythological master of all evil and incarnation of all negative forces, born from the rotting placenta of Wanaadi and constantly struggling against him for rule over the earth
true person, human, where only speakers of Maquiritari are considered “truly” human

(Maquiritari mythology) A mythological figure functioning variously as a god, shaman, and culture hero, created by the sun and creator of humans, who lives in the Sky (kajunña) and no longer interferes with earthly affairs
swelling that is happening to something or someone
Marks the third person for nouns and postpositions with an initial vowel
to clear a field or garden in slash-and-burn agriculture; to assart
